sentences.en: American society in 19 th century - led by American " Calvinism " and Presbyterian Church.
sentences.cn: 19世纪美国社会与文化的主流，由长老会，美国版本的加尔文主义领导！

sentences.en: Calvinism was spread through the denial of the inerrancy of Scripture by theolohical liberals as God raised up men to stand against them.
sentences.cn: 因着新派神学人士否认圣经无误，神兴起人与这些自由派对抗，加尔文主义就传播开了。

sentences.en: Calvinism was the most convenient religion since the days of the ancients.
sentences.cn: 加尔文主义是自古以来最方便的宗教.

sentences.en: He was a restless activist who tried to point England in the direction of Calvinism. later in 1559 following study under Calvin;
sentences.cn: 他是一个忙碌不息，企图指引英国朝着加尔文主义方向的积极分子。 1559年他跟随加尔文学习。

sentences.en: Historically, Emerson marks one of the largest against the Calvinism of his ancestors.
sentences.cn: 在历史上, 爱默生是他的先辈敬奉的加尔文主义最大的反对者之一.

sentences.en: John Calvin was a Frenchman, but he is being remembered in Geneva this week because it was here that he built Calvinism.
sentences.cn: 约翰加尔文是法国人，但本周他却在日内瓦被人们纪念，因为正是在这里，他创立了加尔文教派。

sentences.en: This denomination has its origins in Calvinism.
sentences.cn: 这一教派源自加尔文教.

trans.tran_cn: 加尔文教派，加尔文主义
trans.tran_en: the Christian religious teachings of John Calvin, based on the idea that events on Earth are controlled by God and cannot be changed by humans
